main-use-cases: Note-taking;As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content)
share-wikis: No, but I may export content into other formats and share individual tiddlers, the whole wiki, or an extract of the wiki
value-of-tw: Helps me greatly to organize the large amount of constantly changing information that I need to manage for my work. In my personal life, I use it to organize the notes I take from books and articles, to discover more connections between the things I read, to retain more knowledge
tw-ability-level: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins;I am comfortable using WikiText widgets (e.g. <$transclude>, <$list>...);I am comfortable writing filter expressions
backup-method: Consumer online storage (e.g. Google Drive, Dropbox);Web or cloud hosting (other than TiddlyHost/TiddlySpot e.g. Netlify, AWS, OVH, Google Cloud...)

tw-customisations:
Macros for easy linking to issue-tracking system at work by ticket ID, and other similar link macros.
Button-linked actions to create new pages from a template, with given title, tag, and custom field
project-strengths:
Stability and backward compatibility,
consistent vision
project-weaknesses: first-party, officially supported desktop and mobile apps would be nice
ok-to-publish: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
